business.headline: India slashes import duty on bourbon whisky to 100% after Trump's criticismThe reduction in customs duty on bourbon whisky was notified on February 13 just ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's talks with US President Donald Trump.
What is digital lending? 5 key benefits you should know Digital lending platforms make use of advanced technology, thereby making the loan process faster, simpler and more efficient.

New Income Tax bill: Has it really been simplified for taxpayers?The proposed income tax bill seeks to simplify and revamp the Income Tax Act of 1961, which has often been criticised for its complexity, making it challenging for ordinary taxpayers to navigate.
New UPI transaction rule: All you need to know about auto chargeback processThe changes are primarily regarding auto acceptance and rejection of chargebacks, thereby making the system more efficient.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as FIIs continue to exit Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 199.76 points to end at 75,939.21, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 102.15 points to close at 22,929.25.

Explained: Why Vodafone Idea share price tumbled nearly 6%VI shares were down 5.09% to Rs 8.22 at around 3:15 pm. Earlier during the trading session, shares of the telecom operator fell as much as 6%.

Ambani family richest in Asia. Check which Indian families made the top 20The Ambani family tops Bloomberg's list of Asia's 20 richest families. The family's flagship company, Reliance Industries, is presently headed by Mukesh Ambani, son of late industrialist Dhirubhai Ambani.

RBI curbs on New India Co-operative Bank: How does it impact customers?New India Co-operative Bank has been struggling with financial losses in recent years. According to its annual report, the bank recorded a loss of Rs 22.78 crore in the financial year ending March 2024, following a loss of Rs 30.75 crore in the previous year.

New India Co-operative Bank's financial operations halted after notice from RBIThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has restricted Mumbai-based New India Co-operative Bank from issuing loans, accepting deposits, or permitting withdrawals for six months. The move comes amid concerns over the bank's financial health and liquidity.

Not Trump's tariffs, but this is what's making stock market investors anxiousThe stock market jitters have occurred despite government measures, including tax relief and the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) decision to reduce the repo rate by 25 basis points.

RBI issues notice to halt all financial operations of New India Co-operative BankRBI's move comes after what it called 'recent material developments' at the bank. Although the central bank did not provide specific details, it stated that these directions were issued to protect depositors' interests.

New income tax bill: All you questions answeredThe new income tax bill, compared to the Income Tax Act, 1961, is nearly half the size, containing 259,676 words, 23 chapters, 536 sections, 57 tables and 46 formulae.

entertainment.headline: Stand-up comic Anubhav Singh Bassi's Lucknow show cancelled by copsThe shows of comedian Anubhav Singh Bassi in Lucknow were cancelled due to concerns over inappropriate content, following a complaint by the UP Women's Commission vice-chairperson. Authorities cited potential law and order issues as reasons for the cancellation.

Watch: Chum Darang blushes as Karan Veer confesses love on Valentine's DayKaran Veer Mehra confessed his love for Chum Darang on Valentine's Day. Chum shared a post from their romantic outing on social media.
Watch: Ed Sheeran pauses Delhi concert as fan faints, wears Team India jerseyEd Sheeran wrapped up his India tour in Gurugram on February 15. He paused his concert briefly to help a fan who fainted.

Shalin Bhanot reacts to India's Got Latent Row, advocates self-disciplineTV actor Shalin Bhanot has reacted to the controversy surrounding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's comment on India's Got Latent during the FDCI's India Men's Weekend in Jaipur. He emphasised self-discipline and responsibility.

Today is a victory: Jay-Z reacts after rape lawsuit against him droppedIn a significant legal victory, rapper Jay-Z has seen a sexual assault lawsuit against him dismissed. The rapper and entrepreneur expressed relief and satisfaction over the court's decision.

No one can save him: Mahabharat actor threatens Ranveer Allahbadia Actor Saurav Gurjar openly threatened Ranveer Allahbadia over his recent remarks on India's Got Latent. In a video message, the actor requested the government to take strict action against the podcaster.

Drake releases new album amid feud with Kendrick Lamar, fails to impress fansDrake appears to have ended his feud with Kendrick Lamar in his latest album, but fans remain unimpressed. Released on Valentine's Day, the album in collaboration with PartyNextDoor marks his first new work since the Super Bowl halftime show.

Bharti Singh supports Samay Raina amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Bharti Singh supported Samay Raina amid the India's Got Latent controversy. The comedian praised Samay and said that he is very sweet, and anyone can become his fan once they get to meet him.

Women's panel summons Elvish Yadav over remarks against Chum Darang on Feb 17YouTuber Elvish Yadav has been summoned by a women's panel following his racist remarks against Chum Darang. Yadav criticised her name and nationality, sparking courage among northeastern citizens.

Apoorva Mukhija aka Rebel Kid removed from official IIFA ambassador listApoorva Mukhija, known as Rebel Kid, has been removed from the IIFA ambassador list following controversy over her appearance in Samay Raina's show, India's Got Latent. The decision follows threats from Karni Sena to disrupt her upcoming shoot.

Fighting zombies to playing a psychopath: The many faces of Choi Woo-shikLong before Choi Woo-shik became a household name thanks to Parasite, he had already amassed an impressive filmography. On this week's K-Fix, we'll have a closer look at his notable works, crafted long before his Oscar-winning turn in Parasite.

The Potato Lab trailer: Kang Tae-oh is set to headline upcoming rom-comThe trailer for The Potato Lab, a romantic comedy-drama starring Kang Tae-oh and Lee Sun-bin, has been released. The series, set in a rural potato research institute, promises a blend of romance, comedy, and workplace drama.

general news.headline: Special Kumbh train, ticket sale surge led to Delhi stampede: Probe reportDelhi railway station stampede: At least 18 people, including children and women, were killed in a stampede in the New Delhi Railway Station due to overcrowding of passengers waiting to board trains for the Maha Kumbh Mela.

Elon Musk's DOGE cancels $21 million funding for voter turnout in IndiaElon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has announced a decision to cut $723 million in foreign aid funding as part of its broader budget overhaul plans.

18 killed in Delhi stampede, high alert sounded, inquiry ordered  Live UpdatesA high alert has been sounded at all railway stations across Uttar Pradesh in view of the stampede at the New Delhi Railway station which claimed 18 lives on Saturday. A two-member committee has also been formed to probe the incident.

Aftermath of Delhi station stampede: Shoes, belongings strewn, cops nowhereSeveral videos of the aftermath of the stampede at the New Delhi railway station, which killed 18 people, show massive crowds jostling through the station with their luggage. Several pairs of shoes and other belongings were found strewn on an escalator.

Profanity, vulgarity, lewd jokes are all part of culture tooFrom abuses in Gaari Geet and Holi meetings, to profanities hurled at the deity at a temple fest in Kerala and expletives being used as conjunctions in everyday life, Indians need no primer on bawdy jokes and cuss words. And that's culture too. A look at that culture even as Indians outrage over Ranveer Allahbadia and Samay Raina.

Elon Musk reacts after influencer claims she gave birth to his 13th childElon Musk, a day after influencer Ashley St. Clair claimed she had given birth to his 13th child, has reacted to one of the posts that said St. Clair had been trying to "ensnare" the Tesla CEO.

Delhi stampede: Opposition's 'negligence' jab, BJP calls out 'political vultures'The Opposition accused the Centre of "mismanagement" after 18 people died in a stampede at the New Delhi railway station. The incident occurred due to a sudden rush of devotees boarding trains to Prayagraj for the Kumbh Mela.

Trump says no laws broken if he 'saves his country', quotes NapoleonDozens of lawsuits currently challenge Donald Trump's executive orders, including the ongoing crackdown against illegal immigration, attempts to ban transgender people from serving in the US military and efforts to overhaul the federal workforce.

How accessible is quality elder care in India?A 2023 report states that the elderly population in India is projected to increase from 10.1 per cent in 2021 to 20.8 per cent by 2050. Are we ready for it?

People crossed tracks, barged into train: Eyewitnesses on Delhi stampede horrorEyewitnesses of the stampede at the New Delhi railway station that killed 18 said there was a huge rush as several people were heading towards Prayagraj for the Maha Kumbh. They alleged that there were no police personnel to manage the crowd.

Video: Madhya Pradesh groom collapses on horseback in wedding procession, diesThe incident, which took place in Sheopur city on Friday night, was caught on CCTV. Footage shows the victim on horseback, entering the venue with many people accompanying him.

DK Shivakumar silent as clamour to replace him as Karnataka Congress chief growsDespite being at the centre of these developments, Shivakumar has maintained his silence and refrained from publicly commenting on the ongoing controversy.

Video: Car drags man for 50 metres after spat for 'overtaking' in BengaluruThe incident took place in Bengaluru's Nelamangala highway toll booth, and according to information, the argument broke out as soon as the vehicles approached the booth, which escalated into a physical confrontation.
UP woman injected with HIV-infected needle by in-laws over unmet dowry demandThe woman's father alleged that his daughter had been subjected to constant torture by her in-laws over dowry demands.

India set for historic Champions Trophy record with wins vs PAK, BANIndia stand on the verge of a historic Champions Trophy record, needing just two more wins to cement themselves as the most successful team in tournament history while aiming to end their 12-year ODI title drought.

Andhra man tries to rape his aunts, mother kills him, dismembers bodyPrakasam Superintendent of Police, AR Damodar, said K Lakshmi Devi (57) allegedly murdered her son, K Shyam Prasad (35), a cleaner, on February 13.

Who is Ashley St Clair? Columnist claims she is mother of Elon Musk's 13th childAshley St Clair, a columnist and conservative author, claimed that she gave birth to Elon Musk's 13th child five months ago but kept it a secret for the child's safety and privacy. Musk has not responded to the claim yet.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Delhi stampede: Railway Minister says situation under control, probe orderedRailway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said four special trains were operated to handle the sudden rush of passengers heading to Prayagraj for the Maha Kumbh at the New Delhi railway station, where 18 people died in a stampede.

US, Russian officials to hold Ukraine war talks in Saudi, Zelenskyy 'not invited'Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who met with US Vice President JD Vance in Germany on Friday, said Ukraine was not invited to the talks in Saudi Arabia and Kyiv would not engage with Russia before consulting with strategic partners.
Watch: Ed Sheeran pauses Delhi concert as fan faints, wears Team India jerseyEd Sheeran wrapped up his India tour in Gurugram on February 15. He paused his concert briefly to help a fan who fainted.

People invading my mother's clinic, sending death threats: Ranveer Allahbadia YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia revealed that he was scared for his life, claiming that he and his family have been receiving death threats over the past few days following his remarks at India's Got Latent.

Where the dead warn the living: Darien Gap, deadliest stretch on donkey routeA second flight with over 100 Indians who migrated illegally to the US will land in Amritsar today. Most of them and others who are in the US illegally took the donkey route. The Darien Gap -- a 97-km stretch on the border of Columbia and Panama -- is the most dangerous part of the South American donkey route. Here's all about the Darien Gap and its dangers that have forced immigrants even to abandon their children.

Teen killed, 4 injured in Austria after Syrian man goes on stabbing rampageA 23-year-old Syrian asylum seeker stabbed several passersby in Austria on Saturday, killing a 14-year-old boy and injuring four other people, police said.

Sushant Singh Rajput's father hopeful as High Court to hear plea on actor's deathThe Bombay High Court is set to hear a PIL regarding the deaths of Sushant Singh Rajput and his former manager on February 19. Sushant's father, KK Singh, expressed hope for justice.

How actor Sivakarthikeyan helped cricketer Sajana during 2018 Wayanad floodsActor Sivakarthikeyan extended help to cricketer Sajeevan Sajana after the 2018 Wayanad floods, as revealed in a recent interview. Sivakarthikeyan, Sajana's co-star in Kanaa, ensured she received new cricket spikes after her kit was lost.

Mawra Hocane on Sanam Teri Kasam success: My husband's bringing luckSanam Teri Kasam's re-release numbers surpassed its initial box office performance. Actor Mawra Hocane, whose wedding coincided with the release date, believes that the marriage brought luck.
Watch: Ed Sheeran pauses Delhi concert as fan faints, wears Team India jerseyEd Sheeran wrapped up his India tour in Gurugram on February 15. He paused his concert briefly to help a fan who fainted.

sports.headline: Champions Trophy: Additional tickets for India matches in Dubai to go on saleAdditional tickets for India's matches in Dubai during the ICC Champions Trophy will go on sale on Sunday, February 16. Apart from the India matches, semi-final 1 will also be played in Dubai.

Champions Trophy Classics: When Hardik Pandya's flair couldn't stop PakistanWhen Hardik Pandya's fiery knock in the 2017 Champions Trophy final gave India hope, only for a mix-up with Ravindra Jadeja to cut it short, leaving fans wondering what could have been.

Rashid Khan bigger cricketer than Wasim Akram: Rashid Latif makes bold claimFormer Pakistan skipper Rashid Latif has made a huge statement that Rashid Khan is a bigger cricketer than Wasim Akram. Rashid has been one of the star players for Afghanistan in the last decade.

First Vishy Anand, now Botez sisters take Gukesh 'hostage' in funny postCanadian chess stars Alexandra and Andrea Botez shared a hilarious "hostage" photo with Indian world champion D Gukesh, delighting fans with their trademark humour after a similar viral post featuring Viswanathan Anand.

Harmanpreet Singh not 'too disappointed' with Spain loss, eyes finishing improvementIndia captain Harmanpreet Singh said that he wasn't too disappointed with the loss to Spain in the FIH Pro League on Saturday, February 15. India lost the match 1-3 despite taking the lead in the match.

Omar Marmoush's hat-trick doesn't surprise Manchester City boss Pep GuardiolaOmar Marmoush's hat-trick against Newcastle United didn't surprise Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola as he felt it was just a matter of time before the Egyptian forward would find form in the Premier League.

Why Champions Trophy 2025 could be the end of England's BazballEngland have been living with the Bazball mantra for a few years now, but the results have stopped to come for the side in white-ball cricket. Will a lack of consistency, poor form and results lead to end of the approach after the Champions Trophy?

India set for historic Champions Trophy record with wins vs PAK, BANIndia stand on the verge of a historic Champions Trophy record, needing just two more wins to cement themselves as the most successful team in tournament history while aiming to end their 12-year ODI title drought.

Bumrah-less India look to end 12-year ODI title drought in Champions TrophyIndia will once again head into another ICC event being favourites to lift the title. However, the Rohit Sharma-led side has been jolted by the absence of their ace speedster Jasprit Bumrah for the mega event. Hence, they have a herculean task of going all the way in the tournament without their biggest match-winner in recent times.

Spain script Paris revenge on India with 3-1 win in Pre League HockeySpain avenged their Olympic defeat with a 3-1 victory over India in the FIH Pro League, capitalising on defensive lapses and penalty corners. Despite taking an early lead, India struggled with cohesion and execution throughout the match.

Niki Prasad is here to stay after fairytale debut for Delhi Capitals WPL 2025: Reigning U19 World Cup winning captain Niki Prasad won the Player of the Match award against Mumbai Indians after making her debut for the Delhi Capitals on Saturday at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara.

Why Champions Trophy 2025 could be the end of England's BazballEngland have been living with the Bazball mantra for a few years now, but the results have stopped to come for the side in white-ball cricket. Will a lack of consistency, poor form and results lead to end of the approach after the Champions Trophy?

Bumrah-less India look to end 12-year ODI title drought in Champions TrophyIndia will once again head into another ICC event being favourites to lift the title. However, the Rohit Sharma-led side has been jolted by the absence of their ace speedster Jasprit Bumrah for the mega event. Hence, they have a herculean task of going all the way in the tournament without their biggest match-winner in recent times.

Spain script Paris revenge on India with 3-1 win in Pre League HockeySpain avenged their Olympic defeat with a 3-1 victory over India in the FIH Pro League, capitalising on defensive lapses and penalty corners. Despite taking an early lead, India struggled with cohesion and execution throughout the match.

Niki Prasad is here to stay after fairytale debut for Delhi Capitals WPL 2025: Reigning U19 World Cup winning captain Niki Prasad won the Player of the Match award against Mumbai Indians after making her debut for the Delhi Capitals on Saturday at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara.

WPL 2025: Shafali, Niki Prasad star as Delhi beat Mumbai in last-ball thrillerDelhi Capitals beat Mumbai Indians by two wickets in a last ball thriller during the second match of the Women's Premier League 2025 in Vadodara.

RCB vs KKR to flag off IPL 2025, Eden Gardens to host opener and finalRoyal Challengers Bengaluru and Kolkata Knight Riders will kick off the proceedings in the Indian Premier League's 2025 season. The final will also be played at the same venue, on May 25.

Watch: Title-hungry team India land in Dubai for Champions Trophy amid loud cheersTeam India landed in Dubai for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 amid loud cheers from fans. The Rohit Sharma-led side will begin their campaign against Bangladesh on February 20.

RCB rope in former Gujarat Giants star as replacement for Shreyanka PatilFormer Gujarat Giants player Sneh Rana has joined Royal Challengers Bengaluru as a replacement of Shreyanka Patil. Shreyanka was officially ruled out of the competition on Saturday, February 15.

Tennis is not a clean sport anymore: Wawrinka on Sinner's 3-month banTennis stars Nick Kyrgios and Stan Wawrinka have slammed the 3-month ban of Jannik Sinner. The World No.1 player came to a settlement with WADA on the matter of him testing positive for doping back in 2024.

Ben Duckett declared fit for Champions Trophy 2025 after injury scare in IndiaEngland opener Ben Duckett has been declared fit for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 after undergoing scans for his groin injury suffered in India.

Champions Trophy Classics: India's miraculous turnaround vs SA in 2002 semisThe India vs South Africa match in the semi-finals of the Champions Trophy 2002 turned out to be a classic in Colombo. Down and out midway through the second innings, India made an incredible comeback for the ages.

Tennis is not a clean sport anymore: Wawrinka on Sinner's 3-month banTennis stars Nick Kyrgios and Stan Wawrinka have slammed the 3-month ban of Jannik Sinner. The World No.1 player came to a settlement with WADA on the matter of him testing positive for doping back in 2024.

Ben Duckett declared fit for Champions Trophy 2025 after injury scare in IndiaEngland opener Ben Duckett has been declared fit for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 after undergoing scans for his groin injury suffered in India.

Champions Trophy Classics: India's miraculous turnaround vs SA in 2002 semisThe India vs South Africa match in the semi-finals of the Champions Trophy 2002 turned out to be a classic in Colombo. Down and out midway through the second innings, India made an incredible comeback for the ages.

Virat Kohli effectively runs RCB, wanted Rajat Patidar to be captain: KaifFormer India cricketer Mohammed Kaif feels that Rajat Patidar would not have become the RCB captain unless Virat Kohli wanted him to be. Kaif said that the decision was taken keeping franchise's future in mind.

Babar should play at No.3: Amir not a fan of Pakistan star's new roleFormer Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir feels that Babar Azam should be batting at the No.3 spot during the Champions Trophy. Babar was used as an opener during the tri-series ahead of the tournament.

Watch: Harbhajan Singh spotted at a party with Dhoni after 'no friendship' claimsFormer India spinner Harbhajan Singh was spotted with MS Dhoni months after claiming that the duo don't talk to each other.

Pep Guardiola takes bizarre jibe at Liverpool: Cannot do 100 points alreadyManchester City boss Pep Guardiola took a bizarre jibe at Liverpool, claiming that Arne Slot's team won't be able to reach the 100-point mark this season. Liverpool are leading the points table at the moment, while City are in 5th.

Former England cricketer rues 'best bowler' Bumrah's absence in Champions TrophyFormer England cricketer David Lloyd said that he would miss fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah's presence in the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy. Bumrah has been ruled out of the tournament due to a lower back injury.

Watch: Virat Kohli signs autographs for fans before leaving for Champions TrophyStar India batter Virat Kohli was seen signing autographs for fans at the Mumbai airport before leaving for Dubai for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

World No.1 Jannik Sinner banned for 3 months on doping chargesWorld No.1 Jannik Sinner has accepted a 3-month doping ban having tested positive for a banned substance in 2024. Sinner's ban comes weeks after his Australian Open victory where he beat Germany's Alexander Zverev in straight sets.

Watch: India's first batch takes off for Dubai ahead of Champions TrophyThe first batch of India Champions Trophy squad, including captain Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Gautam Gambhir and other staff members took off for Dubai, where they will be playing all their group stage clashes.

Will Champions Trophy turn out to be Australia's worst-ever ICC tournament?An injury-stricken Australia fell to their worst defeat in Asia on Friday, February 14, losing Sri Lanka by 174 runs. Without their entire first choice fast bowling group, could the Champions Trophy turn out to be Australia's worst outing ever in ICC tournaments?

PBKS' Priyansh Arya reveals special message from Suryakumar after record featPBKS batter Priyansh Arya revealed the special message he got from India T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav after his record feat in the Delhi Premier League 2024. Priyansh hit 6 sixes in an over during the DPL match.

England cannot win Champions Trophy due to lack of ODI experience: ButcherMark Butcher questions England's Champions Trophy readiness, citing a lack of ODI match practice as a major hurdle. Following their 3-0 series loss to India, concerns grew over England's ability to compete against top teams.

R Ashwin slams Ben Duckett's India series remark: You are hiding your failuresR Ashwin has slammed Ben Duckett after his India series loss remark ahead of the Champions Trophy 2025. Duckett had claimed he didn't care about the loss to India as long as England go on to win the Champions Trophy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
